text:
been thinking about this over the last couple months. I kinda feel like it’d be nice if the developer docs were more like a wiki, or had a good tool to suggest updates inline.

downside to a wiki is that it’d be hard to distinguish between HubSpot supported techniques and functions vs stuff that could break down the road.

example: My boss was fighting with the selectattr() function for like 30 minutes because the documentation doesn’t show an example of the second parameter being used, and the syntax for it isn’t obvious.(we got it working, but it’d be nice if we could update the documentation to explain that)

The other reason is that atleast in the past there were numerous functions and filters that worked but were not documented. There currently are still a bunch of variables that you can find in developer info if you know where to look, that you can reference but are not explained.
Sounds like a case for open sourcing and allowing for pull requests to me :wink:
I’d be pretty cool with that. - they have numerous projects on github, what’s 1 more?
My thoughts exactly
and one that likely solves a need they feel is a pain to solve themselves
Not sure how it would work out with the new hovering tips stuff they were doing, but for the basic copy, yeah, just have us edit markdown files and make PRs

markdown would be ideal, but if it had to be raw html just to be able to handle the differen’t UI things (never seen a markdown based page with a tabber for viewing code and it’s output) I’d be okay with it.
Unrelated feedback - the content staging tool when creating a new page asks you for the page name right off the bat, then asks you again for the same page name once you’ve picked a template.
I originally read this as “peach it brother, Peach!” :peach:

also unrelated feedback - the page editor is now throwing an error that is “illogical” 
<https://spin.d.pr/xZbt5G+>

when you create a new page you have to set the publish date, but the only way to do that is to click the error tooltip. which then brings you to the publish tab where you choose publish now or later. It’d be nice if it just took you there… There’s no point in the error except to make marketers confused.
why did the publish tab vanish anyways?
:slightly_smiling_face:
It is a little weird right. Took me a few minutes to realize what happed to it.

I’m kinda guessing since it’s still accessible by the error link, someone accidentally just broke the tab’s display somehow. I can’t see a reason to get rid of it, except to maybe make the whole publish tab show in a new format, like a modal or something
I just realized… if the only way to adjust the publish date is by hitting the top right publish button on first creation of a page, you can no longer schedule updates to a published page.
Unrelated: What plugin do you use to vidcap?

I use droplr. There’s a free version and a paid version. My boss bought myself and him a lifetime membership to droplr.

It’s hands down the best tool I’ve used so far for this sort of thing, and the version we have has no limits. can do video screengrabs or record to gif, or just normal screenshots.
Seems like a sound investment. So much easier to explain functionality or a glitch that way. Thanks Jon!
No problem. I’d say it was worth every penny, I use it every day multiple times a day.

Anyone else having problems the the in-app help button (support inbox) spinning and spinning and not actually showing help?

Not sure how to get support if the support button isn't working.
HubSpot Support Number: <tel:1888-482-7768|1 888-482-7768> x3
(saved in my phone :joy:)
x5 for partners :slightly_smiling_face:
Is that true?
Yes it is <@U25C65C3S>
: mind blown :
Dude… join the Club!
You are now part of a secret society.
Might have to haze you first tho.
Yeah <@U25C65C3S>, they rolled this out as a "partner benefit" at INBOUND like 2 years ago I think it was. lol
hmmm. the inbound i missed.
figures
good to know now
You missed an inbound?

But the support employees always act as if it's an error because it doesn't ask for you to input the portal ID so they have to ask you for it. Still, much less (or nonexistent) hold times in my experience than x3. I think they said these were suppose to be more senior support people or that they would know we are an agency partner as well but not sure that that's the case.

does the non-partner one work like this?
<https://youtu.be/5UT8RkSmN4k?t=18s>
I've been unnoficially told HubSpot clients with CMS (sites) have a lower churn rate, does HubSpot have public figures that can share about <@U22PU4G4A>? (part of my investigation for a post)
I don't think we have any public-facing stats (though I'll check), but it is true that retention is much higher for customers using the CMS.
Fantastic, thanks!
